TopicTitle: Rocket blew up and broke physics!

Articles.Content: The laws of the universe are broken.

Son of a gun, that happened to me earlier today! I was experimenting with attaching winglets directly to decouplers, so I could ditch them when the rocket leaves the atmosphere. I decoupled them on the launchpad to test that they'd decouple properly and not clip into itself and spaz or something, and they infiniglided similar to the video.
It's a known bug that has been there, like, from the very beginning.
The music in that youtube does fit the dance of the winglets well. Got to say, looks like a funny but harmless bug.

*sigh* Attention all Kerbal Space Center personnel! Please close all windows and stay indoors if possible. For all outdoors activities protective headgear is required. Heavy precipitation of metal parts is expected today, with values up several kilograms per square meter. Stay inside, stay safe. That is all.
Hey, that happened to me, after I crashed a plane in the water. I thought it was just bouncing in the water. For a very long time...

Infiniglide Ho!

As MBobrik says, it's been there a LONG time apparently. The guys at Squad really need to get down and invent a physics engine that is more like Ferrams Aerospace mod.
and ruin all the fun we have with it????
